At Wed, 30 Apr 2008 13:26:38 -0000,
"nfoscarini" <nfoscarini@...> wro=
te:
> 
> > why sha1 reported in crawl.log is __different__
> > from the out=
put of `openssl dgst -sha1 Filename.pdf`
> > (Filename.pdf previously downl=
oaded)??
> 
> I would guess that Heritrix is including the header informati=
on in the
> data stream when generating the sha1. Rather then skipping forw=
ard to
> the start of the data content.

No, I don=E2=80=99t think so.

sha=
1 as reported by Heritrix is base32 encoded; most tools use a hex
encoded s=
ha1.

For example, base32 encoded sha1 of the empty file is
3I42H3S6NNFQ2MS=
VX7XZKYAYSCX5QBYJ, but hex encoded sha1 of the empty
file (as reported by o=
penssl & most other tools) is
da39a3ee5e6b4b0d3255bfef95601890afd80709. The=
y are the same value with
two different encodings.

best,
Erik Hetzner
